text: Designer Draws Horrible Clients And Their Ridiculous Requests For Free Work By Izza Sofia , 21 Feb 2017 Subscribe to newsletter Like us on Facebook Every creative professional has heard the phrase “work for exposure”. It implies that your work will be seen by a relevant audience, but it probably also means that you would not be paid. This has always been a controversial topic within the creative community, as some argue that it devalues all artists’ work while others point out that unpaid work can lead to bigger projects or adds to your portfolio. Tired of seeing request after request for free work, Toronto-based illustrator and graphic designer Emmie Tsumura has made an illustration series out of them. ‘For Exposure’ is a photo series inspired by Ryan Estrada’s Twitter account , which serves as a large database of such ridiculous requests. These illustrations are for photographers, designers, illustrators and painters who can relate to such nightmarish clients and shockingly dismissive “job” postings.
